titleStmt.title: A letter from a citizen of Glasgow to his friend at Edinburgh. Containing some modest animadversions on a late printed letter, concerning the affairs of that city.
titleStmt.author: J. B.

notesStmt.note: Written in opposition to John Anderson of Dovehill, the provost of Glasgow, this work is a reply to a letter which, the author is persuaded, "no body but Dovehill could be at the pains to write."--cf. p. 9.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
